concept.title: Handling Communication Problems Between APP and

section.p: When the communication between APP and is no longer possible, for example, because is stopped, APP suspends the processing of requests. An internal flag is set in the APP database: APP_SUSPEND=true, and an email is sent to the address specified in the APP_ADMIN_MAIL_ADDRESS configuration setting.
Contact the operator to make sure that is up and running again correctly.
You then have the following possibilities to resume the processing of requests by APP:

ol.li: Click the link provided in the email.

Log in to APP.
APP is restarted instantly. In the APP database, the APP_SUSPEND key is set to false.

section.p: As an alternative, you can proceed as follows:

ol.li:
In a Web browser, access the Web interface (base URL) of APP.
The access URL has the following format:
https://<host_fqdn>:8881/oscm-app
<host_fqdn> is the fully qualified name or IP address of the host used to access , 8881 is the port of APP. Omit the port if is operated with its proxy. oscm-app is the default context root of APP and cannot be changed.

Log in with the ID and password of the user and organization defined by the platform operator in the BSS_USER_ID and BSS_USER_PWD configuration settings.
A message is shown that APP has been suspended due to a communication problem with .

Click Restart.
APP is restarted instantly. In the APP database, the APP_SUSPEND key is set to false.
